name: Celery Soup
author: Jeannie Turicik
summary: Dairy-free, delicious celery soup! Serve plain--absolutely delicious--or with a dollop of sour cream, or a little Parmesan or other shredded cheese.
ingredients: 3 tablespoons olive oil, divided, or to taste
2  carrots, peeled and chopped, or more to taste
1 ½ pounds baby yellow potatoes, peeled
1 teaspoon dried thyme, or to taste
½ teaspoon salt-free seasoning blend (such as Penzeys Mural of Flavor), or to taste
salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a frying pan over medium heat
Add onion, carrots, and leek; cook until soft, about 5 minutes
Heat remaining olive oil in the same frying
Saute celery to release some of the moisture, about 10 minutes
Transfer celery to the soup pot
Cut parsley into the pot using kitchen scissors
Season soup with thyme, seasoning blend, salt, and pepper
Increase heat to medium-high and bring to a rolling simmer
Reduce heat and simmer until carrots, celery, and potatoes are soft enough to easily puree, about 30 minutes
Remove from heat and cool for about 20 minutes
Puree soup with an immersion blender
Simmer over low heat until heated through, 10 to 15 minutes
Serve immediately or let flavors meld overnight and serve the next day
